intro: Disciphania cubijensis, commonly known as the Cuban disciphania, is a rare flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive disc-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. It features palmate leaves and produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
